intro: Hieracium petioliferum, commonly known as the petioled hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems with hairy surfaces and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by petal-like rays, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium petioliferum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
